statement.tex: \text{Find the integral of the function}\\ \dfrac{\sin^3 x +\cos^3 x}{\sin^2 x \cos^2 x} \,

step.context: \text{Are the following calculations and analysis correct?}
step.reason: \text{Using } \dfrac{\sin x}{\cos x} = \tan x \text{ and } \dfrac{\cos x}{\sin x} = \cot x \\ \text{Also, }\dfrac{1}{\sin x }= \mathrm{cosec}\, x \text{ and } \dfrac{1}{\cos x} = \sec x \\

step.context: \text{Is the following evaluation of the integral}\\ \int \dfrac{\sin^3 x +\cos^3 x}{\sin^2 x \cos^2 x} \, dx \quad \text{correct}?
step.tex:
\dfrac{\sin^3 x +\cos^3 x}{\sin^2 x \cos^2 x} \, = \tan x \sec x + \cot x \, \mathrm{cosec} \, x \\
\implies \int \dfrac{\sin^3 x +\cos^3 x}{\sin^2 x \cos^2 x} \, dx \\ \quad \quad \quad = \int (\tan x \sec x + \cot x \, \mathrm{cosec} \, x ) \, dx \\ \quad \quad \quad = \int \tan x \sec x \, dx + \int \cot x \, \mathrm{cosec} \, x ) \, dx \\
\quad \quad \quad = \sec x- \mathrm{cosec}\, x+C

\dfrac{\sin^3 x +\cos^3 x}{\sin^2 x \cos^2 x} \, = \tan x \sec x + \cot x \, \mathrm{cosec} \, x \\
\implies \int \dfrac{\sin^3 x +\cos^3 x}{\sin^2 x \cos^2 x} \, dx \\ \quad \quad \quad = \int (\tan x \sec x + \cot x \, \mathrm{cosec} \, x ) \, dx \\ \quad \quad \quad = \int \tan x \sec x \, dx + \int \cot x \, \mathrm{cosec} \, x ) \, dx \\
\quad \quad \quad = \sec^2 x- \mathrm{cosec}^2\, x+C
